abstract.text: Searches for records that match a predicate and delivers them to a completion handler.

inlineContent.text: The query that contains the search parameters. For more information, see
The identifier of the record zone to search. If you’re searching a shared database, provide a record zone identifier; otherwise, you can specify
to search all record zones in the database.
The fields to include on each fetched record. To include all fields, specify
; to fetch only system fields, specify an empty array.
The maximum number of records to return in a single set of results.
The closure to execute with the search results.
The completion handler takes a single
parameter that contains either a tuple, or an error if the request fails. For example, when the network is unavailable or the device doesn’t have an active iCloud account.
When present, the tuple contains the following named elements:
An array of tuples. Each tuple includes a record identifier and a

that contains either the corresponding matched record, or an error that describes why CloudKit can’t provide that record. For example, if CloudKit fails to materialize an asset field, it returns an error instead of a partial record. CloudKit sorts the array according to the query’s sort descriptors.
A cursor if the number of results exceeds
; otherwise,
If you specify
and the number of matched records exceeds that value, CloudKit provides only that number of records and a
cursor
— an object that marks a specific location in the full search results. To retrieve the next subset of search results, pass that cursor to the
method.
For information on a more configurable way to search a database, see

abstract.text: Store structured app and user data in iCloud containers that all users of your app can share.
An object that represents a collection of record zones and subscriptions.
Retrieves the next batch of records from an existing search and delivers them to a completion handler.
Searches for records that match a predicate and delivers them to a completion handler.
Searches for records matching a predicate in the specified record zone.
Retrieves the next batch of records from an existing search and returns them to an awaiting caller.
Searches for records in the specified record zone and returns them to an awaiting caller.
Searches for records that match a predicate and returns them to an awaiting caller.
A query that describes the criteria to apply when searching for records in a database.
An operation for executing queries in a database.
An object that marks the stopping point for a query and the starting point for retrieving the remaining results.
A collection of key-value pairs that store your app’s data.
The data type that CloudKit requires for record field names.
An object that uniquely identifies a record in a database.
A database partition that contains related records.
An object that uniquely identifies a record zone in a database.
A value that represents either a success or a failure, including an associated value in each case.
A signed integer value type.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
A value that represents either a success or a failure, including an associated value in each case.
